author: ergopool
title: Build out ERGO Pool Infrastructure
description: We would like to create a stake pool that allows you to stake your Ada and earn the Ergo token.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a simple, new idea that could enhance collaboration between Cardano and Ergo. It's feasible that distributing rewards in different L1 tokens in given stakepools could become a model for future collaborations with many blockchains, and encourage more devotees of non-Cardano chains to look into founding stakepools with Cardano.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind this is, evidently, anonymous. In order to find more information on their roadmap, you have to go to their website. They lay out the plan for the system they want to build, and how it will work for your average delegator as well. It could work, but transparency is a kind of currency when it comes to Catalyst proposals, so I have to give this 3 stars: Will investing in this lead to results? At best a coin flip.
f6_assessments.q2:
The biggest flaw here is that the roadmap doesn't include a timeline with target dates. In the end, either the pool will exist or it won't. But when should we expect it? How often will you let us know about achievements along the way? As a result, the success of the project may be auditable--either we get a functional Ergo Pool or we don't--but the progress of it is not auditable at all. 

This idea is interesting, but the proposers should be somewhat more forthcoming to justify their anonymity. That is my main advice.

f6_assessments.q0:
While this proposal does technically fit the requirements of “cross-chain collaboration”, it is ultimately a selfish endeavor. And by that I do not mean that it should not be done, but only that it should not be done with a grant from Catalyst. 

A stakepool already has the financial incentive of being profitable for the stake pool operator. To take funds from Catalyst to finance a mechanism that is ultimately remunerative almost exclusively for the stake pool operator is not in line with the overall purpose of the Catalyst funding mechanism. 

Ergo can simply be bought on an exchange - there is no real added utility to the Cardano ecosystem by allowing staking rewards to be paid out in Ergo. This sort of mechanism would appeal only to a very small and specific cohort of ADA holders.
f6_assessments.q1: It is very feasible to accomplish this task. There are many well fleshed out resources on the creation, promotion and maintenance of stakepools. It sounds as if the bulk of the technical work to create the mechanism that would allow the deposit of Ergo rewards has already been done.
f6_assessments.q2:
It will be obvious whether or not this task has been completed. There are not very many individual steps that can be audited, but the creation of the stakepool itself and its ability to disburse Ergo is proof enough of project completion. 

Something that should be added here however is whether or not the author owns or operates any other stakepool. This would provide added transparency of the author’s background and intentions.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea described in this proposal is somehow closely aligned with the challenge, as it creates a bridge between Cardano and Ergo. However, the true reach of this proposal is extremely limited, to only the delegators to the Ergo pool, which leads to the questions, is it really necessary and does it truly benefit the entire Cardano space? I have concerns that this is not a priority project considering the potential of this challenge and therefore rated this proposal 3/5.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal describes the roadmap and how it will work well and the proposer is an experienced web dev and blockchain dev therefore I'd assume the project can be built and the risk of failure is low/medium. I have rated feasibility a 4/5.
f6_assessments.q2: The problem, the solution, and the roadmap are all described clearly. The audit of whether the implementation is successful or not is simple and easy. The KPIs however seems to be lacking important ones like the number of delegators expected and the amount delegated to the pool - which ultimately is the only way to prove the success of this venture. If the pool doesn't create blocks, nobody would benefit from this proposal. I have therefore rated auditability a 3/5.

f6_assessments.q0: The content of the proposal is a bit short and sketchy. In the solution section, the proposer writes only 2 lines to describe the idea for his proposal. So I went to the proposer's website to find more information. Overall, the proposal offers a model similar to current ISPO operations on Cardano. The difference here is that users will stake their ADA into the proposer's pool and use the staking rewards to exchange for ERG coins. This proposal only fit a small part of the challege's criteria. The proposal will open the door to better exchange between ADA and ERG. Those who want to own ERG but dont want to buy in the market or dont want to lost transfer fee to buy ERG at CEX exchanges and then transfer to their wallet, that's is great thing of proposal . But It's just a one-way expansion from Cardano to Ergo, the proposer needs more solutions in the opposite direction. ERG holders who want to exchange ERG for ADA will do so through the proposer's Dapps. The risk of this proposition lies in determining the ADA/ERG conversion rate at the end of each epoch. To avoid risks and transparency in the exchange rate, the proposer needs to develop additional solutions on price determination (Oracles).
f6_assessments.q1:
The detailed plan to implement the proposal is divided into 3 phases and the implementation time is 12 weeks. These 3 phases also do not have specific timelines while I see a number of technical solution problems not seen in the proposal. The proponent should make this clear especially in phase 2 of the proposal. If this has not been clarified, 12 weeks to complete the proposal would be inadequate.
Funding requests will be breakdown for development activities. It is not possible to determine the rationality of this allocation of funds because the proponent has not listed in detail the technical work required to implement the proposal. I also tried to find information on the recommender's website but really couldn't find it
The team to implement the proposal is 2 people as described by the proposer. But also no evidence has been presented to confirm the ability and experience of the proposer.
The only feasible thing I found is that the proposer's pool is an active pool with around 260k ADA staked
f6_assessments.q2:
Part of the project progress will be tracked through Pool's activity, specifically here it will be based on the pool's margin ratio in each stage of the proposal of 2%, 4.5% and 100% and according to the implementation roadmap. it will be 12 weeks. However, the proposer needs to provide more ways to track the exchange and withdrawal from ADA to ERG.
Successful proposal when ADA holders want to own ERG through redeeming stake rewards. I'd love to see this success, but in the fair measure, it will be difficult to determine what the success of the proposal will be. Because this is a very new operating model and it is not clear about the technical solution. Perhaps the proponent should do a survey to get the opinion of the community to have a clearer assessment of the success of the proposal.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal requests funding for the development of ERGO-POOL, a project advertised since mid 2021 that offers to exchange ADA staking rewards into ERGO at each EPOCHS and to transfer these into an ERGO wallet.
This project can help connect Cardano and Ergo communities, but I expect that the impact would stay limited. When ERGODEX will be running on cardano blockchain, swapping ada to ERG will be so easy that the service proposed by ERGO POOL will have a low value.
f6_assessments.q1:
ERGO staking pool is up and running and has minted 20 blocks over its lifetime, 15 delegators when writing this review.
The proposer provides a roadmap that is actually existing since 6 months (source: reddit), staking reward payment in ERGO is expected in phase 3. But the timeline is not detailed enough considering the quite high development budget. The team does not provide evidence of having the development skills to achieve what is in the roadmap.
I disagree that it is likely that this project will be successfully implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer offers no milestone and no indicators to enable the community to monitor the correct progress of the project. Considering ERGO POOL twitter activity, I see no trace of project development, only EGO pumping /hype and normal Cardano Stake pool operation. I strongly disagree that the community would be able to monitor the progress of this project.
